alert.note: Alert for Grant; Kenton; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 7:48PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN KENTON, NORTHEASTERN GRANT AND NORTHWESTERN PENDLETON COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM EDT... At 748 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Crittenden. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Crittenden, Fiskburg, Sherman, Morning View, Piner, Northcutt, Bracht, Gardnersville and Verona. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 162 and 168. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
